title: QA-Kayser Lambdoma Cycle Certificate
abstract: This certificate formalizes numerical correspondences between Kayser's Lambdoma (Pythagorean ratio matrix) and QA's mod-24 orbit structure. We identify five verified correspondences where Lambdoma ratios appear in QA's cycle periods, pair counts, and modular structure.

lambdoma_definition.name: Lambdoma (Pythagorean Table)
properties: Symmetric under transpose with reciprocal values
lambdoma_definition.musical_interpretation: Each ratio corresponds to a musical interval

qa_orbit_structure.note: Orbit counts from CLAUDE.md; exact derivation depends on specific evolution rule variant

verified_correspondences.name: Total Pairs Power Structure
verified_correspondences.significance: Total state space size is a power of the Lambdoma's generative prime (3)

verified_correspondences.name: Divisor Abundance
verified_correspondences.lambdoma_connection: 24 is highly composite; divisors form rich ratio set
verified_correspondences.qa_significance: Rich divisor structure enables multiple orbit periods

orbit_period_hierarchy.description: Orbit periods form a divisibility chain

lambdoma_diagonal.description: The number 3 generates both Lambdoma diagonals and QA structure
lambdoma_diagonal.lambdoma_role: 3/1 and 1/3 are fundamental intervals (twelfth and its inverse)
lambdoma_diagonal.qa_role: 3 is the period ratio and prime factor of pair counts

mathematical_structure.observation: The primes 2 and 3 (the first two Lambdoma generators) completely determine QA's modular structure
mathematical_structure.significance: QA's orbit hierarchy is generated by the same small primes that generate musical harmony in the Lambdoma

limitations: Exact orbit derivation depends on specific QA evolution rule variant
Empirical orbit computation with simple (b,e)->(e,d) rule produces different counts
Correspondence is numerical, not yet a proven isomorphism

upgrade_path.next_target: Prove that Lambdoma ratio lattice is isomorphic to QA divisor lattice
